Has anyone ever tried running KSP on their Windows 8(.1) tablet?

I just wondered because maybe one day (or that day may have come) KSP will become a mobile game in a sense. I mean you can play it on laptops yeah but on tablets? Have you done it yet? (And if you have what tablet did you do it on?)

-PCGeek
Yes, but my Intel Atom had serious problems running it without mods ...

Yes, but my Intel Atom had serious problems running it without mods ...

Atom??

o my....

i cant tolerate playing the stock game with my older gen1 i5 2.6G+ATI 5670M notebook... cant even imagine how it would be like on an atom...

it's pretty ok when i tried the game on my newer i5 +GTX760m notebook, but i dont quite like it anyways, the computer gets hot very quickly

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

i think yes, you can probably play the game with a tablet running win8, as long as your CPU dont go crazily hot and you can tolerate the performance.

but for me... i'll totally give up the idea...

Edited April 2, 2014 by lammatt

My first reaction to this is that a tablet alone doesn't have enough buttons to push to do everything. You'd need a keyboard connected as well, though personally I'd really want a mouse; controlling cameras in 3D space with a touchscreen has always been troublesome for me.
Worked perfectly fine on my Surface, but haven't used it since 0.22 for ksp
